definition: to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The dearth of evidence on-site gave rise to various explanatory hypotheses.
sentences.chinese: 由於缺乏現場證據，因此出現了各種假設性解釋。

sentences.english: If you’ve never experienced these, then they are just hypothetical questions.
sentences.chinese: 如果你沒有經歷過這些，那麼這都只是假設性問題。

sentences.english: The student became quiet and did not respond to the professor’s hypothetical statement.
sentences.chinese: 那位學生沉默不語，沒有回答教授這個假設性的陳述。

sentences.english: Theory is very often a purely speculative undertaking.

sentences.chinese: 這裏是一個假設性的例子。

sentences.english: Your second question is a hypothetical one, which I cannot answer.
sentences.chinese: 第二個問題是一個假設性問題，我現在無法回答。
